questions.stem: Which bacterium is dominant in the normal vaginal flora of a reproductive-age woman?

Which factor is listed as predisposing to vaginal infections by altering the normal vaginal pH?
Bacterial Vaginosis (BV) is the commonest cause for which type of vaginal discharge?

Which microscopic finding is characteristic of Bacterial Vaginosis (BV) and is part of Amsel's criteria?

What is a recommended oral treatment for Bacterial Vaginosis (BV) in non-pregnant women?
options: Metronidazole 500 mg twice a day for 7 days
Doxycycline 100 mg twice daily for 7 days

questions.stem: Candida Vaginitis (CV) is the second most common cause of vaginitis in the childbearing period. It typically flourishes in which type of vaginal environment?
The main symptom of Candida Vaginitis (CV) is usually:
The typical vaginal discharge associated with Candida Vaginitis (CV) is described as:
options: Copious, yellow or green, frothy, offensive
Scanty, thick, odorless, white (cottage cheese discharge)

questions.stem: What is the typical vaginal pH in a case of Candida Vaginitis (CV)?
What is the standard CDC recommended oral treatment for non-complicated Candida Vaginitis (CV)?
options: Metronidazole 500 mg twice a day for 7 days
Doxycycline 100 mg twice daily for 7 days

questions.stem: Trichomonas vaginalis (TV) is classified as what type of organism?
What characteristic appearance may be seen on speculum examination of the cervix/vagina in 25% of Trichomonas vaginalis (TV) cases?
What is the characteristic feature seen on a saline wet mount preparation of the vaginal discharge in Trichomonas vaginalis (TV)?
The recommended treatment regimen for Trichomonas vaginalis (TV) for both partners is:
options: Doxycycline 100 mg orally twice daily for 7 days
